questions.question: Which type of correlation must be used to find correlation between Study hours and Rank a student got (1-5)?
What is the main difference between descriptive and inferential statistics?
options: Descriptive statistics summarize data, while inferential statistics make predictions based on data.
Descriptive statistics use probabilities, while inferential statistics do not.
Inferential statistics are used for qualitative data, while descriptive statistics are used for quantitative data.
Descriptive statistics require hypothesis testing, while inferential statistics do not.
questions.answer: Descriptive statistics summarize data, while inferential statistics make predictions based on data.

questions.question: What does the Central Limit Theorem state about the distribution of sample means?
options: Sample means always follow a normal distribution regardless of sample size.
The distribution of sample means approaches normality as the sample size increases.
The population distribution must be normal for sample means to be normally distributed.
Sample means are always equal to the population mean.
questions.answer: The distribution of sample means approaches normality as the sample size increases.

questions.question: Which measure of central tendency is least affected by extreme values?
What is the primary purpose of hypothesis testing in statistics?
options: To determine whether a statement about a population parameter is true
To summarize data using measures of central tendency
To calculate probabilities for random events
questions.answer: To determine whether a statement about a population parameter is true

questions.question: Which probability distribution is used to model the number of successes in a fixed number of independent trials?
What does it mean if two events are mutually exclusive in probability theory?
options: They can occur at the same time.
The occurrence of one event affects the probability of the other.

questions.question: In probability, what is the difference between independent and dependent events?
options: Independent events have equal probabilities, while dependent events do not.
Independent events occur simultaneously, while dependent events occur sequentially.
Independent events do not affect each other's probabilities, while dependent events do.
Independent events are mutually exclusive, while dependent events are not.
questions.answer: Independent events do not affect each other's probabilities, while dependent events do.

questions.question: What is the significance level (α) in hypothesis testing?
options: The probability of rejecting a true null hypothesis
The probability of accepting a false null hypothesis
The threshold for determining statistical significance
The mean value of the test statistic
questions.answer: The threshold for determining statistical significance

questions.question: "If A and B are independent events, then P(A ∩ B) = ?"
"What is the purpose of Bayes' Theorem in probability?"
Which of the following is NOT a measure of central tendency?
What is the primary purpose of Chebyshev’s Inequality?
options: To determine the probability distribution of a dataset
To estimate the minimum proportion of values within k standard deviations from the mean
To calculate the mean of a dataset
questions.answer: To estimate the minimum proportion of values within k standard deviations from the mean

questions.question: Which correlation method is best suited for ordinal data?
The sum of deviations of all values from the mean in a dataset is always:
In a symmetric distribution, which measures of central tendency are equal?
Which visualization technique is best suited for comparing the spread of multiple datasets?
What does a high standard deviation indicate about a dataset?
options: The data points are closely packed around the mean
The data points are widely spread from the mean
questions.answer: The data points are widely spread from the mean

questions.question: What is the interquartile range (IQR) used for?
options: Measuring the spread of the middle 50% of data
Finding the average of a dataset
questions.answer: Measuring the spread of the middle 50% of data

questions.question: Which of the following is true about a normal distribution?
options: The area under the curve is 1
questions.answer: The area under the curve is 1

questions.question: Which dataset is best visualized using a scatter plot?
What is the difference between population variance and sample variance?
options: Sample variance uses n-1 in the denominator, while population variance uses n
Sample variance includes all possible values
questions.answer: Sample variance uses n-1 in the denominator, while population variance uses n

questions.question: Which of the following correlation values indicates the strongest relationship?
A box plot does NOT show which of the following?
What is the primary advantage of using percentiles?
options: They provide a measure of central tendency
They help compare values across different distributions
They show the correlation between variables
questions.answer: They help compare values across different distributions

questions.question: Which measure of dispersion is least affected by outliers?
Which type of dataset is best suited for paired t-tests?
Which method is used to estimate missing data points in a dataset?
What does a negatively skewed distribution indicate?
options: Most values are concentrated on the right
The mean is greater than the median
Most values are concentrated on the left
questions.answer: Most values are concentrated on the right

questions.question: Which of the following indicates that two variables have no correlation?
In a dataset, the 75th percentile means that:
options: 75% of values are below this point
75% of values are above this point
It is equal to the mean
It represents the most frequent value
questions.answer: 75% of values are below this point

questions.question: Which type of correlation must be used to find correlation between Study hours and Rank a student got (1-5)?

What percentage of data lies within one standard deviation from the mean in a normal distribution?
According to Chebyshev's inequality, at least what percentage of data lies within 2 standard deviations of the mean for any distribution?

If two regression lines intersect at a right angle, what is the value of the correlation coefficient?
Which data type is appropriate for recording student grades as A, B, C, D, or F?
The sum of deviations from which measure of central tendency is always zero?
Which measure of dispersion uses only two observations?
What is the shape of a normal distribution curve?
If the coefficient of variation for dataset A is 15% and for dataset B is 20%, which dataset has more relative variability?
Which correlation coefficient is most appropriate when dealing with tied ranks?
What does the interquartile range (IQR) measure?
options: Difference between maximum and minimum values

questions.question: Which of the following is not a measure of central tendency?
In a normal distribution, where are the mean, median, and mode located?
options: Mean at center, others at tails

questions.question: What happens to the variance if all data points are multiplied by a constant k?
Which of the following is true about outliers in a box plot?
options: They are always included in the whiskers
They are represented by dots beyond the whiskers
They are never shown in box plots
They are part of the box
questions.answer: They are represented by dots beyond the whiskers

questions.question: If two variables have a correlation coefficient of -0.9, what does this indicate?
Which of the following is an assumption for Pearson correlation?
options: Variables must be measured on ordinal scale
Sample size must be at least 100

questions.question: What is the primary purpose of regression analysis?
options: To predict values of dependent variable
questions.answer: To predict values of dependent variable

questions.question: If the mean of a dataset is 50 and the standard deviation is 10, what is the coefficient of variation?
Which measure of dispersion is dimensionless?
What does a standard normal distribution have as its mean and standard deviation?
Which of the following is not affected by extreme values?
What is the relationship between the mean, median, and mode in a right-skewed distribution?
Which graphical representation is best for comparing the distribution of multiple datasets?
If P(A) = 0.3 and P(B) = 0.4 and the events are independent, what is P(A ∩ B)?
What does the mode represent in a dataset?
Which of the following is true about the standard deviation?
options: It is always positive or zero
It equals the square of variance
It is always less than the mean
questions.answer: It is always positive or zero

questions.question: What are quartiles used to divide a dataset into?
If a dataset has a bimodal distribution, how many modes does it have?
What is the formula for calculating the z-score of a data point?
Which of the following is not a property of the normal distribution?
options: Total area under the curve equals 1

questions.question: What does a box plot's whiskers typically represent?
Which correlation coefficient is appropriate for non-linear monotonic relationships?
What is the formula for calculating the range of a dataset?
If the correlation coefficient between two variables is zero, what can be concluded?
What is the relationship between variance and standard deviation?
Which measure of central tendency should be used for ordinal data?
What percentage of data lies within two standard deviations from the mean in a normal distribution?
What is the value of R² in a perfect linear relationship?
Which of the following is true about the mean of a dataset?
options: It is always one of the values in the dataset
It minimizes the sum of squared deviations
It is not affected by extreme values
It equals the mode in all distributions
questions.answer: It minimizes the sum of squared deviations

questions.question: What is the primary difference between Pearson and Spearman correlation?
options: Pearson measures linear relationships, Spearman measures monotonic relationships
Pearson is for continuous data, Spearman is for categorical data
Pearson requires large samples, Spearman works with small samples
Pearson is parametric, Spearman is non-parametric
questions.answer: Pearson is parametric, Spearman is non-parametric

questions.question: If the mean of a dataset is 75 and each value is increased by 5, what is the new mean?
What does a histogram primarily display?
options: Frequency distribution of a single variable
questions.answer: Frequency distribution of a single variable

questions.question: Which of the following is a relative measure of dispersion?
In a perfectly symmetrical distribution, what is the relationship between mean and median?
What does a low standard deviation indicate about a dataset?
Which of the following is true about the median?
options: It is the arithmetic average of all values
It divides the dataset into two equal halves
It is the most frequently occurring value
It is always equal to the mean
questions.answer: It divides the dataset into two equal halves

questions.question: What is the formula for calculating the weighted mean?
options: Sum of values / Number of values
Sum of (values × weights) / Sum of weights
Middle value when arranged in order
questions.answer: Sum of (values × weights) / Sum of weights

questions.question: If the standard deviation of a dataset is zero, what does this indicate?
options: The dataset contains only one unique value
questions.answer: The dataset contains only one unique value

questions.question: Which of the following is not an assumption of simple linear regression?
What is the primary purpose of a Q-Q plot?

A researcher wants to study the relationship between hours of sleep and exam performance. Which correlation coefficient is most appropriate if the relationship appears non-linear but consistently trending?
A dataset of house prices in a neighborhood has a few extremely expensive mansions. Which measure of central tendency would best represent the typical house price?
A quality control manager wants to monitor the consistency of product weights. Which measure of dispersion would be most useful for comparing batches with different average weights?
When analyzing student test scores, what does a left-skewed distribution indicate about the test?
options: Equal number of high and low scores
The test was of average difficulty

questions.question: A marketing researcher wants to compare customer satisfaction ratings (1-5 stars) across different product categories. Which visualization would be most appropriate?
In a study of medication effectiveness, what does it mean if the p-value is 0.03?
options: The medication is effective for 3% of patients
There's a 3% chance the results occurred by random chance
The sample size was too small
questions.answer: There's a 3% chance the results occurred by random chance

questions.question: A fitness app tracks users' daily step counts. What would a bimodal distribution of step counts likely indicate?
options: Most users are either very active or very inactive
Users typically walk the same amount each day
Users are gradually increasing their activity
questions.answer: Most users are either very active or very inactive

questions.question: When analyzing the relationship between advertising spending and sales, what does an R² value of 0.75 indicate?
options: 75% of the variation in sales can be explained by advertising spending
Sales increased by 75% due to advertising
There is a 75% chance the relationship is significant
questions.answer: 75% of the variation in sales can be explained by advertising spending

questions.question: A teacher wants to normalize test scores with a mean of 75 and standard deviation of 10. If a student scores 2 standard deviations above the mean, what is their score?
When comparing the heights of male and female athletes, which visualization best shows both the central tendency and spread of each group?
A company measures customer wait times, which follow a right-skewed distribution. What is the likely relationship between mean and median wait times?
In a study of income distribution, which measure best represents the typical household income when there are many millionaires in the dataset?
A quality assurance team measures the diameter of manufactured bearings. What does a small standard deviation indicate about the manufacturing process?
When analyzing the effectiveness of two different teaching methods, what is the primary advantage of using paired data?
A meteorologist records daily temperatures. What does a high positive kurtosis value indicate about the temperature distribution?
options: More extreme values than a normal distribution
More values near the mean than a normal distribution
questions.answer: More extreme values than a normal distribution

questions.question: When studying the relationship between age and reaction time, what would a negative correlation coefficient indicate?
options: As age increases, reaction time decreases
As age increases, reaction time increases
Age and reaction time are unrelated
questions.answer: As age increases, reaction time decreases

questions.question: A researcher studying the heights of adult males finds that the data follows a normal distribution. What percentage of men would be expected to have heights within 1.96 standard deviations of the mean?
When analyzing customer satisfaction scores (1-10), what is the key advantage of using the median over the mean?
options: It's not affected by extreme ratings
It can be used with categorical data
questions.answer: It's not affected by extreme ratings

questions.question: In a clinical trial comparing two treatments, what is the main purpose of randomization?
A retail store tracks daily sales. What would a seasonal time series pattern indicate?
options: Sales follow a consistent cyclic pattern
questions.answer: Sales follow a consistent cyclic pattern

questions.question: When comparing the effectiveness of three different fertilizers on plant growth, which statistical test would be most appropriate?
A company surveys employees about job satisfaction using a scale of 1-5. What type of data is this?
In a study of the relationship between exercise and blood pressure, what role does blood pressure play?
A university wants to predict student GPA based on high school GPA, SAT scores, and study hours. What type of analysis would be most appropriate?
When analyzing the effectiveness of a weight loss program, what is the key advantage of using a control group?
options: Allows for comparison with no intervention
questions.answer: Allows for comparison with no intervention

questions.question: A manufacturing process produces items with weights that follow a normal distribution. If 2.5% of items are too heavy, how many standard deviations above the mean is the upper weight limit?
What is the key difference between Spearman and Kendall's Tau correlation coefficients?
options: Spearman works with categorical data, Kendall's with numerical
Spearman uses ranks, Kendall's uses actual values
Spearman measures strength, Kendall's measures only direction
Kendall's handles tied ranks better than Spearman
questions.answer: Kendall's handles tied ranks better than Spearman

questions.question: In a study of factors affecting house prices, what does multicollinearity among predictor variables cause?
A researcher collects data on student performance before and after an intervention. What is this type of data called?
When analyzing the relationship between income and education level, what does heteroscedasticity in the data indicate?
What is the primary purpose of standardizing variables in statistical analysis?
In a study of disease prevalence, what does a relative risk of 2.5 indicate?
options: The exposed group has 2.5 times higher risk than the unexposed group
The disease affects 2.5% of the population
The sample size was 2.5 times larger than needed
questions.answer: The exposed group has 2.5 times higher risk than the unexposed group

questions.question: When analyzing customer purchase data, what would a high standard deviation in purchase amounts indicate?
options: The average purchase amount is high

questions.question: A researcher wants to determine if there's a relationship between smoking status and lung cancer. Which statistical test is most appropriate?
What is the main limitation of using the range as a measure of dispersion?
options: Cannot be used with large datasets
Always equals zero for constant data

questions.question: When analyzing the effectiveness of a new medication, what does statistical significance indicate?
options: The medication has a large effect
The results are unlikely due to chance
questions.answer: The results are unlikely due to chance

questions.question: In a normal distribution, what is the relationship between the mean, median, and mode?
A company tracks customer complaints. What would a Poisson distribution of complaints indicate?
options: Complaints occur at a constant average rate
Complaints are related to customer demographics
questions.answer: Complaints occur at a constant average rate

questions.question: When comparing the effectiveness of four different teaching methods, what is the main advantage of using a factorial design?
A researcher wants to predict whether a student will pass or fail a course based on attendance, previous GPA, and study hours. Which analysis is most appropriate?
What is the key difference between a parameter and a statistic?
options: Parameters are calculated from samples, statistics from populations
Statistics are calculated from samples, parameters from populations
Parameters are always normally distributed, statistics are not
Statistics are always more accurate than parameters
questions.answer: Statistics are calculated from samples, parameters from populations

questions.question: In a study of the relationship between exercise and weight loss, what role does a confounding variable play?
options: Affects both the independent and dependent variables
questions.answer: Affects both the independent and dependent variables

questions.question: When analyzing data from a Likert scale survey (1-5 agreement ratings), which measure of central tendency is most appropriate?
What does a high standard error of the mean indicate about a sample?
options: The sample mean varies little from the population mean
The sample mean may not represent the population mean well
questions.answer: The sample mean may not represent the population mean well

questions.question: A researcher wants to compare income distributions in three different countries. Which visualization would be most effective?
In a study of factors affecting crop yield, what does a significant interaction effect indicate?
options: The effect of one factor depends on the level of another factor
The model has good predictive power
The factors should be analyzed separately
questions.answer: The effect of one factor depends on the level of another factor

questions.question: What is the key advantage of non-parametric statistical tests?
options: They always provide more accurate results
They don't require assumptions about data distribution
questions.answer: They don't require assumptions about data distribution

questions.question: A company wants to determine if a new website design increases time spent on the site. What type of hypothesis test should they use?
When analyzing the relationship between advertising expenditure and sales, what does autocorrelation in the residuals indicate?
options: Time-dependent patterns not captured by the model
questions.answer: Time-dependent patterns not captured by the model

questions.question: What is the primary purpose of stratified sampling?
In a study comparing treatment effects, what is the main purpose of calculating effect size?
When analyzing customer satisfaction data, what does a high kurtosis value indicate?
options: Customer ratings are clustered around the mean with some extreme ratings
questions.answer: Customer ratings are clustered around the mean with some extreme ratings

questions.question: What is the key difference between interpolation and extrapolation?
options: Interpolation uses means, extrapolation uses medians
Interpolation estimates within the range of observed data, extrapolation estimates beyond it
Interpolation works with categorical data, extrapolation with numerical
Interpolation requires larger sample sizes than extrapolation
questions.answer: Interpolation estimates within the range of observed data, extrapolation estimates beyond it

questions.question: A researcher wants to determine if there's a relationship between education level and income. What type of data would education level be?
When analyzing the effectiveness of a weight loss program, what does a Type II error represent?
options: Concluding the program works when it doesn't
Concluding the program doesn't work when it does
Correctly identifying that the program works
Correctly identifying that the program doesn't work
questions.answer: Concluding the program doesn't work when it does

questions.question: In a study of factors affecting house prices, what does multicollinearity make difficult?
options: Determining the individual effect of each factor
questions.answer: Determining the individual effect of each factor

questions.question: What is the key difference between a histogram and a bar chart?
options: Histograms are for numerical data, bar charts for categorical data
Histograms show frequencies, bar charts show percentages
Histograms have gaps between bars, bar charts don't
Histograms are always vertical, bar charts can be horizontal
questions.answer: Histograms are for numerical data, bar charts for categorical data

questions.question: When analyzing the relationship between study time and test scores, what would homoscedasticity indicate?
options: Equal variance of test scores across all study times
questions.answer: Equal variance of test scores across all study times

questions.question: What is the primary purpose of a residual plot in regression analysis?
A researcher wants to compare the effectiveness of three different teaching methods across four different subjects. What type of design is this?
